https://image.tmdb.org/t/p/w500/veJf1jGjKpny296xkzN9SowumOq.jpg Boogie Man is a comprehensive look at political strategist, racist, and former Republican National Convention Committee chairman, Lee Atwater, who reinvigorated the Republican Partyâ€™s Southern Strategy to increase political support among white voters in the South by appealing to racism against African Americans. He mentored Karl Rove and George W. Bush and played a key role in the elections of Reagan and George H.W. Bush. Boogie Man: The Lee Atwater Story
